item.description: pre code, pre, code { white-space: pre !important; overflow-x: scroll !important; word-break: keep-all !important; word-wrap: initial !important; } .left { text-align: left; float: left; width:50%; z-index:-10; border: 5px solid #fff; } Plotting template GEOM_FUNCTION: use a geometric object to represent your data. MAPPINGS: associate data values with visual values. e.g., categorial data -> different colors. STAT: use raw data values or calculate new values from raw values.

item.title: Line plot for time series data
item.description: pre code, pre, code { white-space: pre !important; overflow-x: scroll !important; word-break: keep-all !important; word-wrap: initial !important; } Import data load(url('https://github.com/MingChen0919/gst-colloquium-workshop-2018/raw/master/content/datasets/datasets.RData')) Load libraries library(ggplot2) library(gridExtra) Visualization Feature against frame index Geom object: line frame_index -> x feature -> y # ggplot2 template p1 = ggplot(data = trajectory) + geom_line(mapping = aes(x = frame_index/1000, y = trajectory[, 2]), stat = "identity", position = "identity", color = '#ff6d6d') + coord_cartesian() + facet_null() + #----map data values to visual values--- scale_x_continuous(name = "Frame index") + scale_y_continuous(name = colnames(trajectory[2])) + theme_classic() p1 Distribution of feature values Geom object: density feature -> x # ggplot2 template p2 = ggplot(data = trajectory) + geom_density(mapping = aes(x = trajectory[, 2]), stat = "density", position = "identity", color = '#3dbfff') + coord_flip() + facet_null() + #----map data values to visual values--- scale_x_continuous(name = colnames(trajectory)[2]) + theme_classic() p2 Combine time series plot and density plot grid.

item.title: Network for graph-like data
item.description: pre code, pre, code { white-space: pre !important; overflow-x: scroll !important; word-break: keep-all !important; word-wrap: initial !important; } Load packages, set up working environment. If the packages cannot be found, please install first using install.packages() command. library(ggnetwork) library(sna) library(reshape2) library(ggplot2) The “ggnetwork”" package provides a way to build network plots with ggplot2. The “sna” package contains a range of tools for social network analysis, including node and graph-level indices, structural distance and covariance methods, structural equivalence detection, network regression, random graph generation, and 2D/3D network visualization.
